list_definition.definition: the keeping away from other people or animals of people or animals that might be carrying an infectious disease

list_ex_of_definition.ex_of_definition: My dog was in quarantine for six months.

list_definition.definition: the period in or for which this is done

list_ex_of_definition.ex_of_definition: The quarantine for a dog entering Britain from abroad is six months.

list_definition.definition: to put (a person or animal) in quarantine

list_ex_of_definition.ex_of_definition: The government authorized health authorities to quarantine anyone infected by the disease.

list_ex_of_english: I assure him that positively all imported live poultry is quarantined under the present legislation.
Xinhua says the local agriculture department has quarantined the infected area.
They arrange testing outside the official system so that they will not be quarantined.
Why are we not having an honest discussion about quarantining?
The city had no means of quarantining such large numbers of ill arrivals.
Individual objects can be quarantined through bagging to either contain or prevent infestation.
Genetic material would need to be quarantined in flasks.
When the quarantine station opened in 1891 it was equipped only for the disinfection of commodities.
